newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thailand allows 20,000 tonnes palm oil imports.
newsitem.headline: Thailand allows 20,000 tonnes palm oil imports.

text.p: Thailand on Thursday approved a proposal by palm oil producers to import 20,000 tonnes of crude palm oil to alleviate local shortages, a commerce ministry official said.
The imports, which are likely from Malaysia or Indonesia, must be delivered by the end of August, the official said.
The imports will be tariff free.
However, a government Soybean and Vegetable Oil committee set conditions that palm oil refineries must buy local crude palm oil at or above the guaranteed price of 14.50 baht per kg.
The government also set a guaranteed price for fresh palm fruit at 2.50 baht per kg.
The official said the shortages were caused by a prolonged dry spell during April-June, resulting in a sharp drop in production.
"The crude oil output was only 30,000 tonnes per month while demand exceeded 50,000 tonnes. The shortages sent the price rising to 17.50-18.00 baht per kg," she said.
"The rising consumption made matters worse," she added.
